1.text: And Eliphaz the Temanite will answer and say,

2.text: Shall a man profit to God as he understanding shall profit for himself?

3.text: Did it please to the Almighty that thou wilt be just? and if gain if thou wilt perfect thy ways?

4.text: Will he reprove thee from thy fear? Will he go with thee into judgment?

5.text: Is not thine evil much? and no end to thine iniquities?

6.text: For thou wilt take a pledge of thy brethren, in vain, and the garments of the naked thou wilt strip of.

7.text: Thou wilt not give to the weary one water to drink, and from the hungry one thou wilt withhold bread.

8.text: And the man of arm, to him the earth; and the lifted up of face dwelt in it.

9.text: Thou didst send away widows empty, and the arms of the orphans will be broken.

10.text: For this, snares are round about thee, and sudden fear will terrify thee;

11.text: Or darkness thou wilt not see; and abundance of waters shall cover thee.

12.text: Is not God high in the heavens? and see the head of the stars for they were lifted up.

13.text: And thou saidst How shall God know? Shall he judge in the cloud of darkness?

14.text: Clouds a covering to him, and he will not see; and he will go about the circle of the heavens.

15.text: Wilt thou watch the path of old which men of iniquity trod?

16.text: Who were laid hold of, and no time a river will pour out their foundation?

17.text: They saying to God, Depart from us: and what shall the Almighty do for them?

18.text: And he filled their houses with good: and the counsel of the unjust was far from me.

19.text: The just shall see and shall be glad: and the innocent shall deride at them.

20.text: If our adversaries were not destroyed, and their remnant the fire shall devour.

21.text: Be acquainted now with him, and be safe: by them shall good come to thee.

22.text: Take now the law from his mouth, and set his words in thy heart.

23.text: If thou wilt turn back even to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt remove iniquity far off from thy tent.

24.text: Place thou gold upon the dust, and the precious ore of the torrents of Ophir.

25.text: And the Almighty was thy gold and silver of labors to thee.

26.text: For then upon the Almighty shalt thou delight thyself, and thou shalt lift up thy face to God.

27.text: And thou shalt pray to him, and he will hear thee, and thou shalt repay thy vows.

28.text: And thou shalt decide the word, and it shall be set up to thee: and the light shone upon thy ways.

29.text: For they were humbled, and thou wilt say, A lifting up; and he will save him depressed of eyes.

30.text: He will deliver the island of the innocent: and it was delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
